additionalInformation: For strength heroes, it grants 320 health, 1.6 health regen, 2.67 armor, 32 attack speed, 10% movement speed and 16 attack damage.
For agility heroes, it grants 320 health, 1.6 health regen, 2.67 armor, 32 attack speed, 10% movement speed and 16 attack damage.
For intelligence heroes, it grants 320 health, 1.6 health regen, 2.67 armor, 32 attack speed and 10% movement speed.
Status resistance from multiple Sange-based items ( Sange, Sange and Yasha, Kaya and Sange, Heaven's Halberd, does not stack.
Health regen amplification from multiple Sange-based items do not stack.
Lifesteal amplification from multiple Sange-based items do not stack.
Movement speed bonus from multiple Yasha-based items ( Yasha, Yasha and Kaya, Sange and Yasha, Manta Style do not stack.
Attack speed bonus from multiple Yasha-based items fully stack.
name: Sange and Yasha
description: Sange and Yasha, when attuned by the moonlight and used together, become a very powerful combination.
trivia: The item is a homage to a pair of twin swords the Phantasy Star game series, notably Phantasy Star Online.
Night Stalker refers to Sange and Yasha as "sisters".[1], also Ember Spirit.
Riki's cosmetic item bundle, Sange and Yasha, is based on Sange and Yasha and shares its name.
tips: This item is particularly strong in boosting your midgame. Plenty of stats, movement speed, and status resistance it is very strong on most melee carries.

If you still have a Sange and Yasha by the time you get to the late-game, it may be wise to disassemble it and build the Yasha into a Manta Style, and the Sange into a Heaven's Halberd. The actives from those items are extremely helpful, and the stat bonuses are great.
